page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION OF AREA
page.content: {Glacial deposits of boulder clay and {sand underlie the area.These form a {hummocky surface rising to 26m with {peat filled hollows. Much is covered {by housing. In the west are the more {recent suburbs of Blackpool.The major {development is around the old market {town of Poulton,an important shopping {centre.The majority of housing is {owner occupied and built since {1960.Housing has linked up the hamlets {of Carleton and Hardhorn.A green wedge {has been preserved between Poulton and {Blackpool. Much is grassland for {dairying but some is used for {cemeteries and playing fields.A few {small vestiges of woodland still {remain.There are two industrial {estates at Layton and to the East of {Poulton.The Blackpool-Preston railway {line has stations at Poulton and {Layton.
